data.title: Where to watch 'Hillbilly Elegy,' JD Vance's look at economic divides in America
data.meta_description: Ohio Sen. JD Vance is Donald Trump's vice president pick. Here's how to watch the controversial movie of Vance's life story, \
data.text:
Now that it's been announced that Ohio senator and author JD Vance will be Donald Trump's running mate in the 2024 presidential election, a lot of people are looking to reminisce over the 2020 film adaptation of Vance's 2016 memoir "Hillbilly Elegy."

The movie version of "Hillbilly Elegy" had an impressive amount of hate watches when it was released. Now, with Vance's new potential career upgrade to vice president, people are flocking to Ron Howard's somewhat controversial adaptation of Vance's life.

Whether you're watching for the first time or you're looking to revisit the difficult road Vance walked down to get to where he is now, here's where to watch "Hillbilly Elegy."

Is 'Hillbilly Elegy' based on a true story?

Yes, "Hillbilly Elegy" is based on the life of JD Vance, who talks in detail about his rough childhood filled with violence, poverty, and substance abuse in Kentucky and Ohio.

What is the main point of 'Hillbilly Elegy'?

Both the 2016 novel "Hillbilly Elegy: A Memoir of a Family and Culture in Crisis" by JD Vance and its 2020 film adaptation by Ron Howard ("A Beautiful Mind," "American Graffiti," "The DaVinci Code") examined what it's like for working-class Americans who grew up in poverty and class divisions in America.

What is controversial about 'Hillbilly Elegy'?

"Hillbilly Elegy" was a divisive film when it came out, with critics bashing it every which way and giving it a 25 percent score on movie aggregator site Rotten Tomatoes. Meanwhile, the audience score was a whopping 82 percent.

The critical reviews included Forbes' Scott Mendelson, who wrote, "When your big dissection of American poverty is less insightful and less intellectually honest than the Dukes of Hazzard movie and Joker, that's a problem."

Meanwhile, audience reviews called the movie "inspiring" and appreciated its "emotional" message shared through Vance's real-life struggles. Many felt it was relatable to working-class Americans.

Is 'Hillbilly Elegy' a movie on Netflix?

The 2020 movie "Hillbilly Elegy" is a Netflix exclusive. The streaming company won a bidding war in 2019 and paid $45 million for the rights to Vance's life story.

Where can I view 'Hillbilly Elegy'?

"Hillbilly Elegy" is streaming only on Netflix. You have three subscription options: standard with ads at $6.99 per month, standard without ads at $15.49 per month and premium with no ads for $22.99 per month. Visit netflix.com to see the full details of each plan.
